item.title: Test article
item.description: Bessel’s correction is the reason we use $n-1$ instead of $n$ in the calculations of sample variance and sample standard deviation. Sample variance: $$ s^2 = \frac {1}{n-1} \sum_{i=1}^n \left(x_i - \overline{x} \right)^ 2 $$ When we calculate sample variance, we are attempting to estimate the population variance, an unknown value. To make this estimate, we estimate this unknown population variance from the mean of the squared deviations of samples from the overall sample mean.
